result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Cruz Blanco

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph Cruz Blanco in court.  Attorney Peter John Heflin in court for Joseph Cruz Blanco.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joseph Cruz Blanco in court with attorney Peter John Heflin.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court granted defense request for a new date to allow time to review the DPA.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Joseph Cruz Blanco in court with attorney Peter John Heflin.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joseph Cruz Blanco appeared by video means with Attorney. Defendant to schedule TAD evaluation. Court ordered case adjourned for deferred prosecution agreement hearing in Branch 37.   All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Joseph Cruz Blanco in court with attorney Peter John Heflin.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court canceled the stayed bench warrant based on defendant's appearance in court.  Defense to receive discovery and offer.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.   This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Peter John Heflin in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for status.  No appearance by the defendant.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date.  Case adjourned to Br. 37.  Calendar call scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Joseph Cruz Blanco in court.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joseph Cruz Blanco appeared by video means.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Hearing held via zoom/DAcast. Defendant to retain private counsel Peter Heflin.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.   This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Status conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 026160,
Payable Number: 992909,
Receipt Number: 22RP010747,
Amount: $20.00
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Joseph Cruz Blanco in court.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. 
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/23/22 @ 1:30p
